thread.title: Mariner, Purple Panther showdowns live up to billing in tight affairs
thread.title_full: Mariner, Purple Panther showdowns live up to billing in tight affairs

author: news@courierpublicationsllc.com (Staff)
title: Mariner, Purple Panther showdowns live up to billing in tight affairs
text:
High school boys and girls soccer Mariner, Purple Panther showdowns live up to billing in tight affairs Oceanside girls salvage tie, boys dealt first loss By Staff | Oct 02, 2015 
Whether one is referring to the boys teams or the girls, both Oceanside and Waterville are among the top teams in its respective Class B North soccer regions this season. 
That fact only added to the buildup of the two highly-anticipated contests as the boys squads tangled in Thomaston and the girls in Waterville Thursday, Oct. 1. 
Both Mariner squads were unbeaten heading into Thursday's games, but by days end, only one remained so as the Oceanside girls rallied to salvage a 2-2 tie. 
The Mariner boys however, came up on the short end of a tight 1-0 decision in Thomaston. 
The following is a recap of both contests: 
Girls soccer 
Oceanside 2, Waterville 2 (2 OT) 
At Waterville Oct. 1, the Mariners got a pair of late goals from freshman Hope Butler, which helped Oceanside remain unbeaten on the campaign. Waterville (6-1-2) led 1-0 at halftime. 
Butler's two goals came with 8:44 left off a through ball by Kelsey Brooks, and the second with 5:27 left off a rebound by a shot by Casey Pine. 
Anika Elias scored a first-half goal for Waterville, and assisted on a second-half goal by Sophie Webb. 
Oceanside held a 16-11 edge in shots and a 3-1 edge in corner kicks. Kayln Grover made nine saves for the Mariners and Gabrielle Martin 14 saves for the Purple Panthers. 
In the Maine Principals' Association Heal Point Standings for Class B North, Oceanside (8-0-1, 63.9796 points) is first in the 18-team region. The top 12 teams qualify for the playoffs. 
Boys soccer 
Waterville 1, Oceanside 0 
At Thomaston Oct. 1, the Purple Panthers knocked the Mariners from the ranks of the unbeaten with a one-goal victory. Waterville (7-2-1) led 1-0 at halftime. 
The lone goal of the game came from Bridger Holly with 26:31 left in the first half. 
Coby Dorr made 15 saves on 18 shots in net for Oceanside, while Jackson Aldrich made six saves on eight shots for Waterville. Dorr also made a save off a penalty kick and Josh Luttrell made a player save off a header for the Mariners. 
In the Maine Principals' Association Heal Point Standings for Class B North, Oceanside (6-1-2, 57.9082 points) is second, while Ellsworth (7-0-1, 61.1480 points) is first in the 18-team region. The top 12 teams qualify for the playoffs.
